ê¸ì •ì í›„ê¸°: The host personally met us at the lodging to introduce us to the accommodation and explain how the keys work.  This was an unexpected extra touch that we really appreciated.  The space is wonderful, with a large shared indoor kitchen/living area plus two separate bedrooms, each with their own bathroom, and a large private outdoor area.  The building is lovely - completely redone inside to feel all new and clean but with perfect historic accuracy regarding the detailing of structure.  This made it feel luxurious.  The towels were soft and fluffy and the bedding felt exceptionally fresh.  There were comfy cushions for extra seating.  The host provided complimentary bamboo tea, which was fun to enjoy.  The location is very nice, towards the north end of the historic area between Gyeongbokgung Palace and Changgyeonggung Palance, with lots of nice shops and cafes close by.

- excellent communication from the moment we booked
- fast response to enquiries
- quick confirmation, provided reassurance (our first family trip)
- our flight was delayed by 2 hours, host met us being dropped off my taxi after midnight (thank you thank you), and gave us a quick induction of the hanok and gifted a plate of the most juiciest fruit
- hanok was clean, cosy, serene, quiet, we felt safe in such a quaint, beautiful neighbourhood.
- minutes to Cafe, restaurant, convenience store, short walk to Anguk station.
- went with My 3 kids, they enjoyed exploring the neighbourhood themselves.
- my teenage son enjoyed his own room and ensuite.
- Christmas tree was a lovely touch.
- we were assured we could ask Yuna anything, they were easily contactable via Whatsapp.
- a wonderful stay, our first stop of our first family trip, I can't thank our hosts enough for opening up their space and for their warm hospitality,  I can't wait for you to experience the same.
